messageBody:
I think my problem does not lies in JUnit but in the Cactus framework
(ServletTestCase). However, thank you to all of you who have shared
their opinion and time with me. I will see if I can find the solution
in Cactus mailing list.

> I am running my JUnit within Cactus Framework. I am thinking of
> making a generic testcase that takes three parameters (or more if
> necessary). They are: method name, input file, and the expected
> output file.

However, just for future reference this is a sample on how to pass
parameter into JUnit test cases.

--- code begin ----
public class AllTests {

public static void main(String[] args) {
}

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite("Test for default package");
//$JUnit-BEGIN$
suite.addTest(new myTest("testMethod1", "My own string
here"));
suite.addTest(new myTest("testMethod1", "My Second string
here"));
//$JUnit-END$
return suite;
}
}

public class myTest extends TestCase {

private String PARAM_TEXT;

public myTest(String sMethodName, String sText) {
super(sMethodName);
PARAM_TEXT = sText;
}

public void testMethod1() {
System.out.println(PARAM_TEXT);
}

}
---- code end ----

The output is:
My own string here
My Second string here

Thanks,
Donny
